results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Mobile Applications;Labor and Jobs;Computers and the Internet;Advertising and Marketing;Zuckerberg, Mark E;Meta Platforms Inc;Facebook Inc;Instagram Inc;WhatsApp Inc
results.title: Meta to Lay Off Another 10,000 Workers
results.abstract: It would be the tech company’s second round of cuts since November. Mark Zuckerberg, its chief executive, has declared 2023 the “year of efficiency.”

media.caption: Mark Zuckerberg, Meta’s chief executive, said last month that he did not want his company to be overstuffed with a layer of middle management.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Books and Literature;Book Clubs;Book Trade and Publishing;Writing and Writers;Content Type: Personal Profile;audio-neutral-informative;Napolitano, Ann (Author);Winfrey, Oprah
results.title: ‘Hi, This Is Oprah Winfrey. I Read Your Novel and Loved It So Much.’
results.abstract: Ann Napolitano toiled in obscurity for years. Novels went unpublished; agents turned her down. She found recognition with “Dear Edward.” Then came the call: “Hello Beautiful” was the 100th pick for what is arguably the most influential book club in the world.

media.caption: The title of Ann Napolitano’s fourth novel “Hello Beautiful” was inspired by her uncle’s salutation on postcards he sent throughout her childhood. “I felt like he was seeing that I was beautiful on the inside and that’s why he wrote it to me that way,” said Napolitano. “I’ve always felt like my real self is on the inside.”
media.copyright: Elinor Carucci for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Documentary Films and Programs;Shipwrecks (Historic);Fashion and Apparel;North Sea;Netherlands
results.title: This Dress Survived for More Than Three Centuries at the Bottom of the Sea
results.abstract: Divers found an almost perfectly preserved dress in the remains of a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 1600s. Researchers are trying to figure out who owned the garment.

media.caption: An almost perfectly preserved dress was recovered from a ship that sank off the Netherlands in the 17th century.

results.adx_keywords: Child Abuse and Neglect;Prisons and Prisoners;Sex Crimes;Glitter, Gary;Great Britain
results.byline: By Jenny Gross and Johnny Diaz
results.title: Gary Glitter Is Back in Prison After Violating Probation Terms
results.abstract: The singer was released from prison last month after serving half of a 16-year sentence for sexually abusing three young girls decades ago.

media.caption: Following his release from prison in February, Gary Glitter had been fitted with a GPS tag and faced other restrictions.

results.adx_keywords: Friendship;Psychology and Psychologists
results.title: I Love You, Now Leave Me Alone: What Friendship Means to an Introvert
results.abstract: It can be hard to reconcile the need for close connections with the urge to cancel plans. Experts say it’s a matter of taking control and finding your comfort zone.

results.title: Where to Stream ‘Everything Everywhere All at Once’ and More 2023 Oscar Winners
results.abstract: Most of the night’s winners can be watched at home. Here’s a guide to help you find the honorees.

media.caption: Michelle Yeoh in “Everything Everywhere All at Once.”

results.title: At Wellesley College, Students Vote to Admit Trans Men
results.abstract: Students supported a nonbinding referendum on Tuesday that calls for opening admission to all nonbinary and transgender applicants. Opponents say the school’s mission is to educate women.

media.caption: Outside of The Lulu Chow Wang Campus Center at Wellesley College, on Monday.
media.copyright: Bea Oyster for The New York Times

results.byline: By Livia Albeck-Ripka and Emily Schmall
results.title: A Giant Blob of Seaweed is Heading to Florida
results.abstract: The mass, known as the great Atlantic Sargassum belt, is drifting toward the Gulf of Mexico. Scientists say seaweed is likely to come ashore by summer to create a rotting, stinking, scourge.

media.caption: A worker removing sargassum with machinery at a resort in Cancun, Mexico, last year.

results.adx_keywords: Television;Colbert, Stephen;Fallon, Jimmy;Meyers, Seth;Kimmel, Jimmy
results.title: Late Night Sums Up the Silicon Valley Bank Situation
results.abstract: “It’s pretty bad when the very first time you ever hear of a bank is when they’re going out of business,” Stephen Colbert said on Monday.

media.caption: “I don’t see how a bank could lose all their money that fast,” Stephen Colbert said. “Why don’t they just attach the money to those chains they put on the pens?”

results.title: Your Annoying Roommate Is Slaying on TikTok
results.abstract: Sabrina Brier is finding success online in the role of a 20-something in New York who’s trying to shed her basic suburban past.

results.abstract: A limited yet growing body of research suggests that one of the most powerful ways to support someone is also the simplest: Start a conversation.

results.title: He Was Compared to Tiger Woods. So Why Did He Walk Away From Golf?
results.abstract: Is it OK for an athlete — or anyone, really — to have an extraordinary gift and not use it? The golfer Anthony Kim apparently decided, emphatically, that it is.

results.title: California Braces for More Flooding as Storm Brings Rain and High Winds
results.abstract: The latest storm in a series of “atmospheric rivers” swept much of the state on Tuesday with strong winds, heavy rain at lower elevations and snow in the mountains, worsening flood risks.

media.caption: Snow was stacked high throughout Running Springs, in Southern California, on Tuesday.

results.byline: By Luke Broadwater and Jonathan Swan
results.title: House Republicans Quietly Halt Inquiry Into Trump’s Finances
results.abstract: G.O.P. leaders are declining to enforce a court-supervised settlement for Mazars, Donald J. Trump’s former accounting firm, to turn over records in an investigation into whether he profited from the presidency.
org_facet: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

media.caption: Mazars USA headquarters in Manhattan in 2021. Democrats fought in court for years to get financial documents from Mazars, and only last year began receiving the documents.

results.title: 2026 World Cup Will Have Four-Team Groups and 24 More Games
results.abstract: FIFA approved a change that set the format for the largest and longest championship in soccer history, and reversed course on discussions to sort the record 48 teams into groups of three.

media.caption: Lionel Messi and Argentina won the 2022 World Cup, the last played with 32 teams.
